meanings.def: the process of helping somebody to have a normal, useful life again after they have been very ill or in prison for a long time
the act of starting to consider that somebody is good or acceptable after a long period during which they were considered bad or unacceptable
examples: the rehabilitation of Magritte as an artist

meanings.def: the process of returning a building, place or area of activity to its previous good condition
examples: the rehabilitation of the steel industry
